summary.p:
A multiple-text manuscript containing two Dharmaśāstra works copied for Ducler in 1830-1831 by Śorakkuḍi (Tamil Curakkuṭi) Kṛṣṇaśasāstrin:
An incomplete Mitākṣarā (Adhyāya 2 only, that is the Vyavahārādhyāya) (U1).
The Vyavahāranirṇaya by Varadarāja (U3, f155v), apparently preceded by an unidentified work (U3, f149r).
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (December 2021).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

collation.desc: 148 folios = Mitākṣarā, Vyavahārādhyāya. Tamil foliation {1}, 2-148. Parallel Arabic foliation 149-287.
1 folio = guard leaf. No foliation. Blank recto verso.
139 folios = Vyavahāranirṇaya. Tamil foliation {1}, 2-139. Parallel Arabic foliation 149-287.

supportDesc.foliation: Tamil foliation: {1}, 2-148 for U1; {1}, 2-139 for U3. Continuous parallel Arabic foliation 1-287 for U1 and U3. No foliation for U2.

additions.desc: Tamil letter ṇa engraved (front cover, verso and back cover, recto).
BnF shelfmark sticker: SANSCRIT 815 (back cover, verso). Pasted over another sticker, which looks like a Burnouf's sticker.

origin.origDate: Internally dated to the year vikṛti of the Jovian cycle, that is, CE 1830-1831. See colophons (U1, f148v2 and U3, f278r1).

provenance.p: Copied for Philippe Ducler by an unnamed copyist in Karaikal Jail. See Burnouf (1832).

acquisition.p: Acquired, July 22nd, 1833, from Philippe Ducler. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 1 = Acquisitions: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1833-1848, no. 92.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
